alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:51PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Escambia and southwestern Conecuh Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 651 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of McCullough, or 14 miles north of Atmore, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... McCullough, I65 And AL 113 and I65 And AL 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
